name: Shane Lee
text: Great time got to watch the ceremony of champions Roll Tide Roll....24/7/365

name: Jake Howle

name: Pawan Subedi
text: Great place for me to do my studies. Thankfully they are open during this pandemic thing as well.

name: Zoe Marie
text:
My absolute favorite and ONLY place to study on campus. I can’t be sure exactly what makes me love Gorgas so much, but I always check it’s hours before I commit to having a Study day, because it’s where I can easily focus, get/stay comfortable, and remain for HOURS.
The staff is great, both librarians and Java City employees, (despite what some people may say in the Java City reviews) and it’s got a space for everyone regardless of noise or atmosphere preferences.
I always study in the 1st floor Mac room. It’s a “loud” level, meaning groups meet up and are allowed to talk at full volume. Some people don’t like this, but being able to have my headphones in and not worry about complete silence around me is strangely comforting. Also, I can answer my phone while studying without worrying about bothering anyone too much.
My only complaint is that I wish Gorgas had hours similar to Rodgers. They are already open fairly late, (usually ~ 7am - 2am) but I am always so happy during dead/finals week when they are open 24/7.
Definitely check out Gorgas library if you haven’t already, you will not be disappointed!

text: Love this place, the library..Yes u can order pizza at 4

name: Thomas Peoples

name: Karen Cook
text: We love this library. We've been going to Pelham Public Library for 11 years and I don't have one complaint. We've been to other libraries in the general area, but this one is our favorite. Before the pandemic, we were going 3-5 times a week.  The librarians are so friendly and informative.  The tech librarian has been so good for my teens. He's always available to help them whether it be library or career related. The teen librarian is always super friendly and happy to see us and willing to order books my kids are interested in when the budget allows. We have had great experiences with the children's librarians as well over the years. So much so, my daughter volunteered to help them for a couple of years after she aged out of the teen librarian program. Overall, our family loves this library, and I highly recommend it.

name: Rich Legler
text: Great selection of manga and graphic novels

name: Nancy Thomas
text: Very nice.Very efficient. Staff helpful,available and attentive.Great library.

name: Arena Hill
text: very helpful staff, back in march when a tornado hit pelham, al had no power, staff here let me charge my phone and was happy. peaceful environment.

name: Chelsea Mack
text: So I have been to multiple libraries in the Jefferson and Shelby counties. However, this particular location in Pelham is outstanding! When I say ALL the staff is on one accord and are super helpful. I mean it. Its rare to find that in today's society at different locations especially during these times. Oberall, they are just great workers and people who love what they do but don't always get compensated for it. Most importantly, I just want to show my appreciation and love for all of them down to Chris, Matt and the women for being so kind and generous during these difficult times. Keep up the great work and don't stop what your doing even on those bad days because you never know whose day you can change but being so compassionate and kind. No matter what your position or title is. You all have a great team and thanks for being a light in the community of Pelham.

name: Shaun Self
text: Pelham Library is the best! Good selection and excellent staff who are always ready with a good suggestion for all my kids. Its the staff that make the place feel like borrowing a book from a friend.

name: Christie White
text: Awesome facility. Before the pandemic, my kids and I would love to hang out here and read or attend story time.

name: Chad Bloomfield
text: This is a great building. I cant wait to be able to enter again. In the meantime, their online order and pickup service is fast & easy and they quarantine the books after return.

name: Sally May A
text: It's clean and the staff is very helpful.

text: Is a library with a variety of contents and are available to the entire public.  It has helped me personally to lend language and audio books.  Also movies, I live in Apelham and I am an Active customer. ah I also book online with your web page.  has a wide repertoire of information with his books

text: I haven't had one single misfortunate event with any of the staff here.  I am Hispanic and come to this library with my 2 daughters for homeschooling and have been received by a very friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable staff.  I'm very grateful this library is available to us and look forward to coming here for homeschooling in the private study rooms, catching up on my reading, and attending kids events in the future.  Thank you Pelham!

name: Wendy Adamson
text: Santa was supposed to be at the library tonight from 6 to 8 pm per the Pelham Library website.  We arrived at 7:15 pm and Santa was gone.  My child is dressed up and crying due to no Santa.  Front desk clerk could care less.  At least we have other opportunities elsewhere.  Do not trust the website or calling.  Merry Christmas!

resp.text: We are terribly sorry for listing the time incorrectly for the Santa Event. We will be much more careful in the future. We are sorry for disappointing your child. We apologize for the inconvenience and disappointment.

The Library at Springville Road, will never be the same after Covid 19...
This was a great library and staff.
I also miss all the adult programs and friends.
People have been isolated for a reason, but as social networking is vital in many areas of our lives. We need the interactions.

text: We regularly frequent both this and the Hoover Library because they are our two favorite in Jefferson County.  Springville Road has fantastic programs for children, wonderfully interactive and helpful librarians, and a solid selection in a pleasant atmosphere.

text: The ppl were so helpful and kind

name: Steve Manhart
text:
It's too bad this is the closest library to me... I've had several poor experiences here lately.  It's the inadequate facility & patrons, not the staff, that I consider to be the problem.  A nearby high school means lots of loud kids after school.  Also other disrespectful adults carrying on long cellphone conversations and tudoring sessions going on in a tight area of the only available tables.  Quiet rules are respected pretty well in the room with public PC's, but the rest of the place could be mistaken for a frat house scene.  ...and finding a satisfactory place to plug-in a laptop, or winning the lottery... which will happen before I'm dead?

Oh, the book collection, you ask?  I suppose people do still look at those in libraries on occasion...  the selection is just o.k.  Of course with the Jefferson Cnty Library Cooperative's sharing program, you have fairly convenient access to a vast library.

name: Katrina Blaylock
text: We have enjoyed coming to this library for years. Story time is every Friday at 10:15, geared toward ages 5 and under, and is followed by a craft. The coordinator for children's activities is very sweet! My son has enjoyed the summer reading program and the activities and prizes they have for it every year. They are currently (Oct 2016) renovating the children's area and it looks like it will be amazing! There are several computers with internet & printing capabilities, comfy sofas and arm chairs to relax, large tables and also cubicles for study.

text: The atmosphere at this library promotes a sense of calmness. When I went to get some homework done, I was greeted professionally, and I felt at home while there.

*DOORS ARE LOCKED 10 MINUTES BEFORE CLOSING*

name: Velisha Hearlson
text: It is awesome

name: Ashley Clem
text: I love all the things available to help with studying and research. There are many computers for student use and areas to study on 1st and second floors of the building. The private study rooms are great when you need less distraction but the position of the rooms make them the hottest areas during the summer and into the fall. The bottom floor is a great area for historians looking to dig into the area's history. Cullman County's law library is also located at this library. The building is rather a little old but is still kept clean and organized. I've done a lot of research at this library over the past 20 years. I'm grateful for the resources and a place to study in silence.

name: Andrew Farrow
text: Fantastic Library with many different tools available to help students with what they need. Also really great place to go between classes to do work or just pass time in general while waiting.

name: Betty Scates
text: Clean quite
